page.title: 01Osier Holt, Shrub Hill
page.content: This remote part of Fenland lies on the borders of Norfolk, Suffolk and Cambridgeshire. The Little Ouse River, flanked by flood protection banks, flows SE -NW through the block. Shrub Hill, with a maximum elevation of 1.6 metres above sea level stands out from the surrounding countryside, much of which is below sea level. The soil is mainly peat over fen clay and sand. Shrub Hill has a Southery postal address (7 miles away), School children attend Feltwell Primary (5 miles) or Methwold Comprehensive School. The East of the block forms part of Hockwold Fens. South of the River the district looks to the City of Ely for its amenities.
